channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Delhi roots: New Sri Lankan PM Harini Amarasuriya's fascinating link to India
item.description: Harini Amarasuriya has been appointed as Sri Lanka's 16th Prime Minister, making her the first woman in this role since Sirimavo Bandaranaike in 2000. An academic-turned-politician, she studied Sociology at Delhi University's Hindu College from 1991 to 1994. Her appointment is expected to bolster ties between India and Sri Lanka.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump shares 'nail salon gossip' that Kamala Harris paying $700 for...
item.description: “Their campaign is getting a bunch of people—that’s why you see these people on the side of the road with signs or whatever going to these protests,” said Gangewere, in the video Trump shared. “They get travel paid for and everything and they’re not even able to vote.” The Daily Beast identified the woman as an OnlyFans model and wondered how Donald Trump got hold of her account.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hindus in Bangladesh... : Bangladesh's foreign affairs advisor addresses attacks on minorities
item.description: Md Touhid Hossain stated that Bangladesh's interim government is ensuring the safety of all citizens, including Hindus. Amid political upheaval and protests against Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus, Hossain met India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar at the UNGA to discuss bilateral relations. Yunus faces allegations of acquiring power unconstitutionally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry wins big in visa case; records will not be made public despite drug revelations
item.description: ​Prince Harry's US visa application will remain private despite his admission of taking drugs in his memoir Spare, a judge has ruled in a big win for the Duke of Sussex. Harry in his memoir admitted that he took cocaine and psychedelic mushrooms triggering the case as to whether he should have been allowed into US in 2020.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran president says Hezbollah 'cannot stand alone' against Israel
item.description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that its ally Hezbollah "cannot stand alone" against Israel, which carried out its deadliest day of air strikes on Lebanon since 2006. The Israeli military said it had hit about 1,600 Hezbollah targets on Monday, killing a "large number" of militants, and had carried out more strikes on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump wants to work at a McDonald's because Kamala did so: 'He's obsessed'
item.description: Donald Trump said he wants to work at a McDonald's for half an hour to see what it's like as Kamala Harris has been bragging of having the experience of working at a McDonald's when she was a student. Donald Trump has been harping that Kamala Harris never worked at a McDonald's and there has been no record and she lied about it only to come across as a relatable, middle-class person.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sweden accuses Iran of cyberattack tied to Quran burning controversy
item.description: Swedish authorities have accused Iran of a cyberattack that involved sending thousands of threatening text messages following Quran burnings in 2023. The messages, attributed to the 'Anzu team,' targeted Swedes and complicated Sweden's Nato membership bid. The investigation by Sweden's SAPO domestic security agency is closed but could be reopened.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy speaks to children briefly from jail; they are in a state of shock
item.description: ​​Diddy shares Christian, Jessie and D’Lila with the late model and actress Kim Porter, who died in 2018 at age 47. Quincy was Porter’s son with partner Al B. Sure!, and Diddy adopted him. He shares Justin with stylist Misa Hylton, and Chance with businesswoman Sarah Chapman. His youngest child Love was born in December 2022. Her mother is model Dana Tran.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US News college rankings 2025: List of top universities
item.description: US News and World Report announced its 2025 rankings for nearly 1,500 U.S. colleges and universities. Categories include best national universities, best national liberal arts colleges, top public schools, top historically black colleges and universities, and top performers on social mobility. US News advises considering these rankings alongside other information when choosing a college.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden acknowledges he's running out of time as violence escalates in Middle-East: Aides
item.description: President Joe Biden acknowledges limited time to secure a ceasefire and hostage deal with Hamas amid escalating Middle-East tensions. Aides express frustration over Israeli PM Netanyahu's contradictory actions. The US is sending additional troops to the region due to rising violence between Israel and Hezbollah, while Biden prepares for his last major speech at the UN General Assembly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Singapore commissions two new submarines as Asia's undersea rivalry grows
item.description: Singapore has commissioned two new advanced submarines named Invincible and Impeccable. Ordered from Germany in 2013, these vessels enhance the country's naval capabilities with advanced technology that allows operation farther from shore using fewer sailors. They also feature air-independent propulsion systems and facilities for female crew members.

item.title: American hiker found dead on South Africa's Table Mountain
item.description: Brook Cheuvront, a 20-year-old student from North Carolina, went missing while hiking on South Africa’s Table Mountain and was later found dead. She had been in Cape Town for an internship. Her body was discovered on Devil’s Peak, and an investigation is ongoing to determine the cause of her death.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is approaching tropical cyclone a threat to Sunita Williams and Crew-9's launch?
item.description: Nasa and SpaceX plan to launch the Crew-9 mission to the International Space Station on September 26, featuring astronauts Nick Hague and Aleksandr Gorbunov. Tropical Cyclone Nine may influence the launch schedule. The astronauts will conduct experiments and maintenance for five months aboard the space station, with a Falcon 9 rocket undergoing a static fire test beforehand.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bird Photographer of the Year 2024: A showcase of exceptional avian photography
item.dc:creator: Bandana Kanak

item.title: Kamala Harris set to visit US-Mexico border amid immigration debate
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris plans a visit to the US-Mexico border in Arizona, focusing on immigration issues and countering Trump's voter appeal. This will be her first trip since Biden's withdrawal from the race. Amid criticisms of her handling of migration, the visit aims to regain voter trust and address key concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Singapore's Indian-origin ex-transport minister no longer facing corruption charges
item.description: S. Iswaran, Singapore's former transport minister of Indian origin, no longer faces corruption charges but will be prosecuted for five other counts including obtaining valuable items as a public servant and obstructing justice. With the prosecution dropping charges under the Prevention of Corruption Act, Iswaran is expected to plead guilty. He was earlier granted SGD 800,000 bail.

item.title: Hurricane John makes landfall in Mexico as Category 3 storm
item.description: Hurricane John has made landfall in Mexico as a Category 3 storm with maximum sustained winds of about 120 mph. Authorities have issued warnings and urged residents to seek higher ground for safety. Evacuations and shelter arrangements are underway, highlighting the severity of the situation and increasing frequency of rapid hurricane intensification.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump visits grocery store in Pennsylvania, vows to lower prices once elected
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump visited a grocery store in Kittanning, Pennsylvania, during a campaign stop. He interacted with customers, promising to lower grocery prices if elected. Trump handed $100 to a local mother for her groceries and emphasized his plans to address inflation and support local businesses. He later held a town hall with farmers in Smithton.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk calls Italy’s Meloni ‘authentic, honest’ at awards gala
item.description: Elon Musk lauded Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni at a New York awards ceremony, emphasizing her authenticity and honesty. Meloni received the Atlantic Council Global Citizen Award for supporting the EU and being Italy's first female prime minister. They are set to discuss investment opportunities in Italy’s space and AI sectors.

item.title: Nearly 500 dead as Israel strikes 1,300 targets in Lebanon
item.description: Israel's airstrikes on southern Lebanon resulted in nearly 500 deaths and 1,650 injuries, mainly targeting Hezbollah members. This escalation follows an incident involving Hezbollah's communication devices. The US calls for restraint and prepares for potential evacuations. Cross-border rocket fire has intensified since last October's conflict with Hamas.
